law.catch_line: Except as provided in subsection (b) of this section and subject to § 13-514 of this subtitle, with...

text.section:
If a tax collector does not make a determination on a claim for refund within 6 months after the claim is filed, the claimant may:
consider the claim as being disallowed; and
appeal the disallowance to the Tax Court.

An appeal to the Maryland Tax Court under this section shall be deemed to be filed within the time allowed for the appeal if a written petition is mailed to the Maryland Tax Court with a postmark date within the time allowed for the appeal.
